resources.string: This application makes requests directly to the Twilio services to send, receive, and manage messages; and retrieve the list of SMS capable phone numbers. \n
Owl SMS is offered \"as is\", without warranty or guarantee.

Version: 2.0 
Release date: November 15, 2017 
 
This application is not a Twilio company application, even though it was developed by Twilio employees. There is a saying within the company, "Just draw the Owl." This is our drawing of an SMS application.

To use Owl SMS, you are required to have a Twilio account with at least one SMS capable phone number. 
 
Go to http://Twilio.com/console to get and manage your account. 
 
The account SID and auth token is located on the page when you first log in. 
 
You can use a free Twilio Trial account with Owl SMS, however, take note of the restrictions. For example, you can only send and receive messages, to and from, phone numbers you have pre-verified. For more information, search for "How does Twilio's Free Trial work?"
Remove the Automatic SMS Reply Messages

By default a Twilio phone number is configured with an automatic reply. You will want to stop the auto-reply. 
 
1. Go to TwiML Bins in the Twilio Console: 
https://www.twilio.com/console/runtime/twiml-bins 
 
2. Create a "no reply" TwiML Bin entry that will be used in the phone number's configuration. 
Click the create icon (white plus sign in red circle). 
Set, Friendly Name: NoSmsResponse 
Set, TwiML: 
 
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?> 
<Response></Response> 
 
3. Click Create. 
 
4. Go to managing phone numbers in the Twilio Console: 
https://www.twilio.com/console/phone-numbers/incoming 
 
5. Click your phone number. 
Under Messaging, Configure with, 
Set, A message comes in: TwiML, NoSmsResponse 
 
6. Click Save. 
 
Now, when a message is sent to your Twilio phone number, there is no automatic reply.
